review: Even though this is a chain restaurant they have really great burgers. You can get a decent sized meal for about ten dollars per person and they even bring you refills on fries.  Sign up for the rewards card and you'll get a free burger for your birthday

Downgrading this review after 2 recent, very poor experiences with the service.  Every time I go in they attempt to sit me in the bar area which is near the door--well, it's Buffalo in January and it's cold everytime the door opens. I don't want to sit there while I'm eating. Further, every time I've sat in the bar area the service is poor because the bartender is also my server.  The most recent visit I went in and was about to be seated at the bar again- I asked the hostess if I could sit elsewhere and she gave me the old eye roll and made it seem like I had asked her to move a mountain. I also have had a problem with meal pacing- I order an appetizer and an entree, I still expect the appetizer to come out significantly before the rest of the meal as the name "appetizer" implies. I don't want it all together.  To avoid this problem, I end up being full of instructions on the entire visit and it's just not enjoyable. "Please don't sit me at the bar. Please don't put my entree in at the same time as my appetizer." It's more cognitive load than I want to impart for a dinner experience that is supposed to be relaxing. I get that it's not a fine dining establishment, but we need some standards here.

My wife and I came for lunch after some black Friday shopping. Red Robin is Red Robin is Red Robin. It's exactly what your expecting. Good burgers and fries at a slightly higher than normal price (12 dollars for a burger and fries because they burger has a slice of pineapple on it?!?!) . We were just in the immediate area and needed some food, plus the garlic fries are amazing. My only complaint is that they clearly weren't staffed for the insane rush they received. We were sat close enough to the wait station to hear the waitresses complaining about the bad planning/staffing for that day. Our waitress (who was also the bartender) was doing her absolute best, but it was just too much for one person. She was friendly and helpful in the 2 interactions we had with her in the hour we were there. We'll be back, hopefully they'll be a little better staffed on the next visit.

This was my second visit to this restaurant and most likely my last. I came here with my daughter because online it said they had burgers for $6.99. When you get into the restaurant the menu says starting at $6.99. I ended up spending with tip $40 for my 2 burgers and two soft drinks. Our burgers were delicious cooked perfect however we got maybe six french fries each with the burgers and they weren't cooked all the way through, they were hard . One good thing, our waitress was very attentive and friendly but the place wasn't busy at all, we went around 430 in the afternoon. She was also the bartender as they seated us in the bar I guess I could've asked for a different seat but the hostess wasn't real friendly we must've waited a good three minutes when we came in for someone to even notice we were standing there to be seated.  Then one of the waiters came into the bar area and was complaining to the hostess who was in there chatting with the bartender, that no one was being seated in his area. It seemed the bar area was where all the employees came to bitch and take their breaks as there was two girls sitting right across from us at the bar eating, chatting with the bartender and they all worked there. We did get a second serving of fries each however this was sparingly and they also were half cooked. When we left I took 1/2 my burger home and I stopped the waiter who was in the bar area again and asked him for a bag and he told me sure, when he didn't come back and we saw him walking around chatting with other people over by the kitchen I asked the bartender if we could have a bag and she said "they're at the desk when you leave want me to get you one?"-I got it myself on our way out. They were starting to get very busy. I gave them three stars because the burgers were delicious I think they should give more fries and I think they should be cooked all the way through like I said ours were half raw. I also think for what we got it was very expensive  and I don't think employees should be hanging out in the bar area chatting about their problems with work and complaining to each other in front of customers, which is why we won't be back.

Over the years I've really tried to avoid Red Robin locations especially since they went to that Ziosk nonsense which more or less became a license for your server to maroon your ass once you place your order. Our visit to this RR location played out like most of our rare visits over the past five years.  We come in and the place is fairly busy and we're quoted the same as everyone a blanket wait time of twenty minutes.  Alright whatever, we'll take it because the proximity to the hotel is very good.  Maybe thirty seconds later they call us for a table while the next group in the door gets quoted twenty minutes.  ?????? Everything regarding the service was glacially slow.  Over ten minutes to get a drink order taken.  Plenty of time afterwards to have the drinks come to the table with another large gap of time to order, etc.  To be fair in terms of the service here, our sever had a lot of tables and she was covering a lot of ground.  But to also be fair we had a good look at the bar area and she really milked it like hell each visit over there with other co-workers taking plenty of time to gab it up. Tavern Double - Mac and Cheese Tavern Double - Southern Charm - Grilled Turkey Burger More or less everything came out as expected with the exception of the Turkey Burger.  Considering the size of the actual patty it's a real rip to charge ten bucks for that thing.  It also didn't help that either the kitchen or the server screwed up the concept of light on the chipotle aioli to hold the chipotle aioli.  Oh boy!  Spoil me with a patty that had the consistency of a rubber chicken and the flavor of a throw pillow.   Now I can already hear you eternal optimists saying that I should just press the little call button on the Ziosk or to flag down a manager and my answer to you is that no management was present the entire meal and while the light on the Ziosk blinked away, nobody came for I don't know eight or nine minutes.  Nothing like lukewarm food and the rest of the your group being well into their grub while yours still isn't what you ordered.  I should also mention that after that wait a different server came to our table to ask what was up as our server was.....somewhere?  Alien abduction?  Deported?  Who knows? Eventually just to get one more up the chute for the road like several other reviews to this listing when it comes to time settle the bill naturally the Ziosk was unable to print a receipt as the only thing that happened was listening to grinding sound of the receipt paper getting stuck on itself inside the unit. I would have pushed the call button again but LOL, yeah right.  Two hours for dinner would be alright at a Melting Pot or a Ruth's Chris.  At a Red Robin that's asinine and we had already put in our fair share of waiting. Overall three of the four burgers came out as advertised which is of course a good thing.  What's not a good thing is that the current hybrid electronica-humonica system which doesn't work if your order has an issue or if you need any help after your food hits the table. Back in the day we frequented this chain more often than we do know (maybe once a year and only when we're on the road) simply because the service has gone to hell with the advent of the Ziosk which has allowed, I'm guessing here, staffing levels to be cut and/or the service angle to change from checking in to see if you need anything, i.e. being proactive, versus hoping your little blinking light on the table is noticed which is stupidly reactive. Thanks but no thanks on this one.

When it's good it's very good. That was the case tonight.  I come here maybe 4 times a year but always in October for my free royalty rewards birthday burger. Can't go wrong there. Sign up for this freebie on the website. Table for 2, no waiting, pleasant attentive server. No issues with ordering or wait times. The burgers tonight were hot, cooked as ordered, juicy. The fries were hot and I love that they are bottomless. I alway get an order to go with my left over burger half. Tonight I had a house margarita on the rocks, $5.50 pretty tasty. Ordered the pretzel bites appetizer, the bites were good the cheese sauce not so much. Won't get those again. The burgers were on point tonight, this visit makes me want to go back sooner rather than later. I can only hope I will have the same good experience.

HORRIBLE PLACE. In the beginning at the table you are supposed to get a electronic called a ziosk and I asked the server for it and they said that the table next to me is using it. Like are you kidding me you don't give another table are ziosk and they didn't even give it to us. Which was really sad. Then, I ordered food and I asked for extra Parmesan cheese. I got it but then I asked for a little bit more because I ran out and the MANGER came over and said you know we're gonna have to charge you 1.00 for extra cheese. And I was thinking in my head are you kidding me I'm paying money for my food you don't tell me this. UNEXCEPTABLE. If customer service would like to post me back I would love that. I am so disappointed. And I will never be back ever again.

I have only discovered Red Robin a couple of years ago even though I've lived in Buffalo for over 15 years. I honestly wish I had come here earlier.  The first time I came here was during the ramen burger promotion. I love ramen so I had to try it out. As far as I remember, the burger was well made and I enjoyed it with my bottomless cole slaw (instead if bottomless fries). But that wasn't the best burger I've had at Red Robin. My favorite burger so far is banzai, the teriyaki sauce and grilled pineapple goes very well together and it is quite unique. I have also tried southern charm and it was great as well. My goal is to try all the burgers and I'm sure I won't be disappointed. In terms of service, I've always gone with a group of friends (10+ people) and the service was always top notch. We would have two waiters/waitresses taking our orders instead of just one. This is great for both the customers and the waiter/waitress. They're not bombarded by a million orders and are able to attend to less customers, while the customers can enjoy more attentive service and shorter wait time. We also celebrated a birthday there and our waitresses were very accommodating and did their best to make sure new plates and silverware were ready to go when the cake was out. Overall a great chain restaurant with amazing burgers, now I can't wait to go back and try another!!

Their slogan says it best: "yum!" Red Robin is one of my favorite burger chain restaurants. There are so many burger options, endless fries, and say you'll try the freckled lemonade (they have an adult version, too).  My most recent visit I tried out the newer item, Marco Pollo sandwich with grilled chicken. It was very juicy and flavorful, but nothing outdoes my fav, the banzai burger.  They've renovated the interior and it looks better than ever. They added classy glass walls around the center booths that act as sound barriers. Before the restaurant was an entire open space; the noise has noticeably cut down. They've also added tvs, which are pretty standard in American restaurants nowadays. I appreciate the no sound so they aren't too distracting from enjoying family time. Also have the screens at the table to place orders and pay your bill. Neat feature, but folks needing reading glasses: don't leave the specs in the car!  I've been here numerous times and staff has always been pleasant. Definitely recommend for families, fun date nights, and parties.  Four stars because endless fries are great, but wish the initial serving was a bit more for how much prices have increased over the past few years. Also the receipt printer at the table was broken and that has appeared in other reviews. Makes it awkward when the server thinks you're taking time to leave and really just waiting for them to walk by, ha.

My wife and I decided to go to Red Robin for her birthday burger. Nothing irritates me more than, (because I have gray hair), being treated like I'm a stupid old person (of which I am neither). The server could not have been put out more after finding out we were there for the birthday burger. After placing our order the food took about 25 minutes to get to the table (for 2 burgers and fries).  We had purchased 2 soda waters at 2.99 each. When I asked for a refill, I was given plain water. The server walked several times past our table, purposely ignoring my attempts to flag her down. When it came time to pay, I was directed to the Zoisk. The server quickly ran through the process of payment, showing how to remove the birthday burger from the bill then quickly disappeared. As I stepped through what I had been shown, I was presented with the screen to sign if I approve of the amount. It was at that point I waited for the server to return. Five minutes later she did and I asked what I did wrong. She proceeded to sign the kiosk by drawing a line and hit submit. She then said it was too late to remove the price of the free burger because I HAD APPROVED THE BILL and that the offer was good for another month, I could come back. At that point I already knew I would never be going back.  Two burgers, and 2 soda waters, plus a tip, $37.00.  So after some back and forth, I was told that the first charge would come off my charge in 3 to 5 days. I ran through the Zoisk process again and printed a receipt (BLANK). Too much of a hassle for burgers and fries. I'll never go back.

Why is Red Robin so good all the time? I just love it. I know its a chain but the food has never disappointed me. The burgers are incredible. They have so many options to choose from. The actual best part is the bottomless fries. I ate maybe 4 fries and our server asked if I wanted more. Yes, I would love more. The fries are thick steak fries. Also the seasoning they have is so good I want to put it on everything.  A cool thing they also have is a tablet on the table. You can order apps and desserts right there without having to wait for a server to come back. You can also pay for games to play as well as your bill when you are finished with your meal.
Went to Red Robin for my free birthday burger and it was delicious! I had the cheeseburger and it was perfect, loved the bottomless fries that came with. Server was attentive and friendly.

We just really love it here.  I know, I know, it's a CHAIN (gasp).  But... we love it.  Husband says their sweet potato fries are pretty much the BEST he's ever had: nice and crispy, served with honey, and , um, ENDLESS for $1.99 upcharge?     Their burgers are consistently fabulous, the Pig Out tavern burger is bacon and burger HEAVEN.  I also love their Whiskey River BBQ burger.  I love that if you have a big appetite, you can add a whole patty for just $1.99.   Love their different dipping sauces for the fries.  They have some of the creamiest and yummiest kids mac n cheese (which is ALSO endless, FYI:  we always order a refill to take home for lunch the next day!) and my kiddo devours her endless oranges as a side dish to her kids meal.   Very family friendly- this was the first restaurant we went to when initially venturing out as first time parents and afraid of people staring if the baby cried.  :)   Crayons, coloring, balloons for the kids - what's not to like? And, no matter when we end up coming here, for some reason we've NEVER had to wait longer than a half hour for a table.  Don't know what kind of magic that is....     Just on this past visit, we found that they started taking  your cell number and TEXT YOU when the table is ready!!!!  awesome!!!

What I like about Red Robin is that it has variety of burgers :D! Service is medium and you can use iPad thing to order. Beware if you play games there is extra charge.  Pros:  -menu options -unlimited bottomless fries  -entertainments(tv & kids)  Cons:  -tables aren't that clean (saw many tables unclean) - I tried the ramen burger before didn't really like it maybe because I had better in NYC

Meh. If you are looking for mediocre, this is the place for you. Service unbelievably slow and limitedly responsive.  Later evening food comes out tired and worn.  The burgers were expensive and not good.  The cooks didn't care to put out appetizing fare.  Cole slaw was bottom of the barrel.  Literally. My hungry child rejected most of his meal because it was extra greasy.  I'm local, but have been to other locations. I would try other locations of this chain, but not this one. Awful.

I'm surprised with myself that I've never reviewed here yet. We often come here before we go see a movie at the AMC, like we did today. Do you know where the 1st Red Robin place was? Seattle. Fun fact for you. We got hooked on Red Robin when we lived out there. It's a nice chain.  My husband loves the burgers. I'm not really a burger person, but they have a lot of other things on the menu I like. They have a salad with chicken fingers in it, that's pretty good. They have a Prime Rib french dip, that's also pretty good. Today I had a BLTA Croissant, that was also very good.   They make a lot of tasty alcoholic beverages and what I really like about them is they have the prices for them on the menu. Have you ever noticed that before, how a lot of restaurants don't like to list the prices for alcoholic beverages? I do and it annoys me. So I like that Red Robin is upfront with prices for booze.   Today we started with the chips with salsa and guacamole. It's $5 and I wouldn't get it again. You get the smallest, tiniest little cups of salsa and guac for that price. We ate it all before I could take a picture.  We also finished with the Mile High Ice Cream Pie thing. It reminded me of Hula Pie, which is a common ice cream pie in Hawaii. I like the one at Duke's in Maui the best, it has macadamia nut ice cream. The Red Robin ice cream pie was pretty decent though. It's vanilla and chocolate ice cream, with a ice cream cake fudge-y stripe between. The plate was covered in caramel and I thought it went really good with the ice cream.  They have those fancy little things on the table now to order more drinks, apps and desserts. Also to pay your bill. The waitress of the future.  Service is always okay to good, never any problems there. I like that I know we can eat here in an hour or less so we can get to movies on time. Overall very happy with this location and Red Robin in general.

My first time at the restaurant.  The server was very pleasant and my kids enjoyed the dinner and atmosphere.  The only downside was that my burger was not cooked to order.  I ordered my burger medium rare and it was well done.  At first, I chalked this up to my wife ordering the same burger and ordering it medium-well, but hers was well done too.  If I am paying $13 for a burger, the least they could do was cook it properly.  If you can't stomach a well done burger definitely skip this place, especially for the money. Follow up:  After writing my original review, I was contacted by a rep via Yelp regarding the experience.  They said they would forward my information and I would hear from customer service in 2-3 business days.  That was 9 days ago and I haven't heard a thing.  So not only does the company provide a sub-par food experience for the money, they also fail to manage customer expectations by over promising and under delivering.  Do not waste your time with this place. 1/12/17-- I FINALLY heard from a customer service representative on 1/10/17, more than two weeks after the time I was informed I would hear back from them.  In they email, I was asked to send them a copy of my check for my meal which made me laugh since it has been 3 weeks since I visited the restaurant.  First, the receipt didn't even print on their little tabletop tablet thing they have, and second, who would actually hold onto it for 3 weeks hoping to hear back from customer service?  If I could give negative stars at this point, I would.
The service was good we had Ashley as our server burger was good desert was so good.Lady room not very clean.
It's a Red Robin. It's not local, and I wouldn't recommend it over a local place if you pushed me, BUT. Bottomless fries. Okay?! Okay.
Good when you have a craving for burgers, but I'm not really a burger person so I eat here not too often.

This location is always disappointing. Some how the food is not as. Ice at this location, and the wait staff are not as good as other locations.  Our waitress made many mistakes. She also wasn't as attentive as desired.   Chicken burger was burnt on outside and almost undercooked on inside (like cooked at very high heat from frozen).  The strawberry lemonade was bitter (which was unusual, as I have had this many times before).  If this was my average experience at RR, then I would never return.

The hybrid electronic + human service is not working. The little touch screen wouldn't print our receipt, so I pressed for the server. A red light flashed from atop the screen for several minutes, but nobody came to the table. After the usual over-priced and mediocre burger, the non-receipt of the receipt pushed Red Robin into my Land of No Return.

I enjoy going to this place for burgers and their bottomless fries. My favorite burgers are the Royal Red Robin-- your classic cheeseburger (patty cooked however you like it) with bacon and egg (over easy or over hard) and the Banzai-- patty with teriyaki sauce and a grilled pineapple ring! WARNING: eating the burgers can get extremely messy. I love their sweet potato fries with honey!! I get this every time with my order for an extra $1.49. It's so addicting and it's bottomless-- so you can order and eat as much as your heart desires for no extra charge!!!! They have an updated system where you an order via a device or through the server. This device is super neat because you don't have to wait for a server to approach you in order to order or pay your bill. A server will approach you anyway, but the system makes getting the attention of a server easier, make an order or additional orders easier, and pay (via credit card though) quickly and easier.  This place satisfies my cravings for burgers and fries every time!

We sat at the bar and we were greeted with "has anyone helped you yet or are you just waiting for your table" by the bartender and we chose to sit at the bar for a beer and dinner. Then it took 45 minutes for our two entrees. The bartender never said anything to us ever besides is the food ok. The gentleman next to us had been there before we got there and ordered two burgers for a to go order and waited over an hour for food. The bartender told him "just let me know if your food is cold or anything" it was rough to watch... this was our second time that we have waited for a really long time got food. We also never saw management.

Food taste and service are fare enough. Price is a little too much for its food's quality. I ordered a red ramen burger with garlic fries. The burger was unique and I like the idea of it, garlic fries doesn't have any garlic flavour in it. The red ramen burger is only available for a short period of time and I do recommend you to give it a try if you are a food adventurer.

Good thing we had gift card. I would never pay for what we got. Food was forgettable, never asked if wanted refills or more fries. Wanted everything done thru kiosk. Bathroom and floor a mess, and tables took forever to get bused.

I love this restaurant!  I've eaten here about 10 times in my lifetime and I can't believe I've never left a review! Every time I come: The place is clean The servers are friendly and personable The service is fast The food is DELICIOUS This particular visit was special because it was our oldest son's fifth birthday and all he wanted was a hamburger for dinner, so clearly we came to the place that specializes in burgers! Our server was so sweet and friendly.  She bonded with our son right away and knew exactly how to interact with him (she has a son around the same age).  She is so great at what she does and I hope she continues to work in the customer service industry because she really is an asset to any business.   The atmosphere here is super comfortable.  The lights are dim, the booths are comfortable and well-maintained, and the noise level is usually just right. The food is completely customizable- you can tell them exactly how you want your burger, sandwich, and sides, and they are more than accomodating.   ATTENTION VEGETARIANS:  Yes, this is a burger joint- and guess what-  ANY recipe can be made with a veggie burger or vegan burger.  They will substitute it for no extra charge.  Yes!!  (Being a newer vegetarian, I was thrilled that I could still order my favorite Whiskey River BBQ burger with a veggie patty- it tasted awesome, by the way.) Our entire party, even the picky guests, enjoyed their meals!  Our son ate his entire cheeseburger, almost all of his fries, and his entire birthday sundae... wow.  That's how you know it's good.  Special shout-out goes to the A-1 burger.  This was my father-in-law's first time here and he tried the A-1 burger.  He loved it so much that he insisted on coming back to order it again.  It's one of those burgers that, when it comes to the table, everyone's eyes pop out and you can see the regret that they didn't order that one, haha! The servers coming out to sing Happy Birthday (Red Robin style) to my son was the cherry on top of a great dinner.  We truly had a good time and look forward to coming back soon.

UPDATE 03/23/16: Was contacted by Kim from RR customer relations.  We discussed the issue with the service and the food.  She issued a gift certificate to us and asked we come back and try RR again. Original Rating: 2 New Rating: 3.5 (I appreciate the follow up after our negative experience).

Am I really giving a chain establishment like Red Robin 5 stars? Yes, Yes I am. It's been a year or two since I ate at a Red Robin so when some coupons came in the mail we decided that it was time to give those bottomless fries another chance. After we spent some some time looking over the new menu I decided that I needed to give the A.I. Peppercorn burger a shot because the picture alone was making my mouth water. What's cool is when you wait for the food you actually have a tablet on the table that you can read stories or play games on with the other people at the table (It does cost $1.99 to play games). When the food itself came it looked just as good as the picture. The burger itself was topped off with bacon and lettuce and was made just right. I don't think I even need to comment on the fries, Red Robin has some really good fries and if you add that special seasoning to them, well, they become perfect. Overall, Red Robin is definitely one of my favourite "chain" restaurants and this will not be the last time I visit one!

Went here last night (Saturday) and it was crazy busy, about a 40 minute wait around 7:00pm. But, it was worth the wait. The last time I was here I had a poor experience l, this time it was great! David, our waiter, filled us in on all the beers on tap and about all the dinner specials. No local craft beers though, only Stella, Blue Moon, and Guinness when it comes to premium ones. We ordered two tavern burgers (two thin patties), one the classic and the other the pig out one with bacon. Both were delicious!  Fries were cooked perfectly. They made an error and gave me fries instead of salad but when I told them they quickly corrected it and the garden salad was super fresh. The thousand island dressing in the side was really good. For dessert we had the brownie cake which came out hot with a big scoop of vanilla ice cream on top. Very yummy!

Been coming for years now. Love the Banzai Burger and who can complain about bottomless steak fries!  Servers are always great. Meal was fine, however, and I can't prove it, but the size of the burger patty seems to be constantly shrinking. I remember on my first visit, the patty was quite substantial. Now it seems on par with a typical Big Mac or Whopper patty in size.
I had THE BEST royal burger tonight! OMG! The yoke was still runny!  Rolling all down the meat- adding to the sauce! OMG  Mmmmmmmmm

Omg as cheesy as it sounds, Red Robin is my go to place bc I know I'm guaranteed satisfaction. It's what I like! I am a sucker for onion straws and let's not mention that they have AMAZING sweet potato fries! Had I been yelping on a regular basis since I became a Yelper in 2011, I would definetely be a Regular here for sure! Any time I'm in the area I make it a point to get my grub on here. So yeah, Red Robin is my secret (well not so secret anymore) obsession. The burgers are on-point, the fries (both regular and sweet potato) are delish and endless!! Highly recommended bc with Red Robin you know what you're getting!

My family and I love loving coming to this Red Robin in particular. Everything is great everytime we come here. They do a terrific job getting people seated. There have been plenty of times where the waiting staff on a saturday night tells us half an hour and we're seated in 15 minutes. The waiters and waitresses are always friendly and the service is great and so is the food. The main reason i am giving this a 5 star rating is because we take my brother here who has Autism and the staff is more than accommadating and great everytime we bring him.

I finally had the chance to try RR out after hearing they have great burgers. It's busy, but we didn't have to wait. The service is great. The burgers are fine. The onion rings are neatly stacked but overpriced.

It's a $10.00 Whopper.  Service is great.  Actually like the place a lot. I could increase corporate profits by 3% if they reduced the quantity of mayonnaise by half.   Need a shower after eating a burger.  So overwhelming I couldn't taste the blue cheese.  Recommendation...... order mayo on the side or invest in clearasil and a good statin

Mike was my server, he was very nice and joked with us.  The food..... I asked for my burger med/med well, it was completely well done. the fries were slim to none, and burgers small. I was not impressed by the food and the price tag was okay but could have definitely been better quality. Im not sure if I want to visit here for the food again but I will for drinks.
I had a Red Robin Gourmet Burger and fries with a Dr. Pepper. The food is great, but our waitress and hostess weren't the friendliest.

While the food was delicious, the service was lacking. Our waitress came by once. Never asked about coffee refill. Also, the fries and the kids sides were supposed to be 'bottomless' and we never got refills on any of that either. So, it was kind of over priced for the portions was ended up with. Probably won't be back. It's been over a year. We ended up back here on an emergency situation. Gotta say, way better. Our server was great, the food was good. I had the guac burger.  I sorta retract my previous review
Great new southwest salad ! Great waitress Heather!!! Check out her pic! Great decor and good beer choices !

Where to begin.    While the food is good, the service and staff leave much to be desired.    When we were seated, no utensils or settings.   Server asked us for drinks but actually recommended that we use the table side computer to order apps, food, etc.    After ordering our drinks and apps (we ordered shakes) we were brought water and a soda.   Apps arrived (well server put them on the table and dashed) but still no shakes.   Shakes did not arrive until after we had finished our apps (still waiting on the utensils and napkins).    Still waiting on food at the moment but I do not see this going well....     Update:    After receiving our food things just continued to decline.   Rolls were soggy at best or just soaked in some liquid before being brought to us.       Although I have visited this location many times in the past, I would think twice before visiting again....

I was not impressed on my last visit as I've been here quite a few times.  My burger was dry and small and med well I ordered med rare, had supposed sauteed mushrooms they were out if a can and skimpy on initial serving of fries and second serving not much bigger. They're may be bottomless fries but the portions are few and I wasn't asked if I wanted more. In the past I got a lot of fries only needed one refill. It seems they make sure you don't get many fries on purpose. My last visit was a few years ago and it seems I got more food then for my $$$$$$.

My wife and I dined at this restaurant on Thursday 3/16 at 7:50pm. It was moderately busy. We got seated right away but it was a while before our server came to the table. By then we were ready to order as we had plenty of time to read and study the menus. We ordered simple.. French dip for her, Whiskey River BBQ wrap for me. Food took a while to arrive and when it did it was by another server (no problem). My wrap was ice cold. My wife's meal included coleslaw as well as fries. the amount of coleslaw on her plate was barely more than 2 tines on a fork. The fries were hot but not plentiful. Our server finally came back to check on us and I asked if my wrap was supposed to be hot..she said yes. I told her it was ice cold. I could see where the cheese was melted at one point (must have been made earlier in the day), She offered to make me a new one, I told her we didn't have the time as we waited long enough for a simple meal. I was hungry and would suffer through this awful meal. I couldn't finish it. She came back and asked if there was anything else, we said no, and she explained about the check on their table top machine and left. No discount on my meal.  We were paying cash and signaled her by using the machine with call server and blinking red light. We sat there with the light flashing on the machine for almost 10 minutes with all kinds of servers passing us by but not ours. Finally we paid and left. I couldn't get out of there fast enough.    I am done. I have frequented this restaurant on numerous occasions and its always a guess on weather the food will be hot. Consider myself, my family and my coworkers...gone.

What could you possibly say bad about endless fries, & big juicy burgers??? Our daughter  loves this place so when you got a pickie 17 yr old you go where their happy. Maybe the drinks could us a little improvement but besides that  We always have a good experience here and this time was no different!

Hello red robin, it's Buffalo. No reservations and No call ahead seating, come on. Told no wait when I called but had a wait when we arrived. We ordered soup and waited again ( too long ). Our table than placed a 2 burger and a fish order, all with bottomless fries. Sorry again too long of a wait. Carly was at the table whenever we needed her, she had the second order of fries their at the right time. Either too many table per server or too many duties. The soup, chowder and French onion were both good. The burger were good ( not anything special ) fish was good for the size. The three hostesses busy talking with each other could of been helping out. Carly brought the food out ( no runners were seen ). I could of had a better burger with a well staffed restaurant in many other places. I will go there next time. Oh the only reason we came here was to use a 20% email coupon. Did not see management anywhere.

Best burger chain restaurant! Hands down my favorite spot to eat at and from, always clean, quick service, and friendly. The herbal fries is AMAZING and free refills! The Sweet potato fries is OUT OF THIS WORLD!!!

You kinda know what to expect when you head to a red robin. This experience was what I would have expected. Our burgers were good, they had a decent selection of beer and there wasn't a long line to get in on a Friday night. Our server was very friendly and polite. Will be back again.

Friends lured me here the other day.  I find myself extremely mixed about this place.  They have all kinds of hamburgers, all kinds of sauces, multiple bottomless sides to choose from.  But at the end of the day, their hamburgers are like a walrus in an attractive dress.  At the center of an otherwise incredible treat(garlic mayo, mushrooms, onion straws) is a tasteless, dry beef patty.  Maybe I've gotten too spoiled by the gourmet burgers over at the Shack on Delaware to enjoy Red Robin anymore.  But if they could get the meat right(and actually the way I ordered it), this place would be phenomenal.  :/  Otherwise it's just lots of good stuff thrown on a crappy patty.   Also the pretzel bites were extremely dry and tasteless little crap-nuggets with some salt and not enough cheese to smother their subpar flavor. However!  The caramel salt milkshake was AMAZING!  DO you hear me?  AMAZING!

I used to come here for lunches semi-frequently. The food is generally pretty good, you know what you're getting usually with a chain. Service is okay, we've had things forgotten sometimes but generally the servers are nice and adequate. Last time I came here me and my dining partner were both very ill- food poisoning bad after and we both had burgers! This scares me and I'll not be able to ever go back because of it. The other thing is it's pretty expensive for what you get, a couple beers and lunch and you've got a $50+ bill, you can definitely find better for the money. Brick House next door is a better option.

Winter for lunches lunch you get filled up on fries really quick to be sure to not to do that. I got the chicken wrap it was awesome. We got the onion rings it is a must try. Is catered towards kids and families. Kind of noisy the service was outstanding

I've been here so many times, I'm surprised that I've never written a review yet.  Came here for late lunch with my mom and sister today. We were told our wait would be 5 minutes though there were several vacant tables. We're seated about 30 seconds later... Umm okay... Everything seems slightly dirty and old. Not as fresh as I remember it being. My sister ordered a grilled chicken meal, I ordered a grilled chicken salad, and my mom ordered a turkey BALT on a croissant. My iced tea was totally diluted. Barely tasted the tea. Then we waited... And waited... And waited for our meals.  When the food finally came, my sister's meal was ice cold. And it was just 2 grilled chicken breasts and fries, not what she was expecting, nor what the menu detailed. We told the waitress and she sent the meal back. Manager came out a few minutes later with a basket of hot fries for her and apologized. My sister asked if they could box her meal since we had been there for so long and she didn't feel like waiting anymore. They did and apologized. When we got the bill, her meal was still on it, but the manager came over and said he would take that off of the bill. Good thing!  I'm pleased with the way they handled the snafu, but I'm disappointed that was my  sister's first experience with Red Robin! She is a picky eater to begin with and doesn't often like to give places second chances, especially if her experience was bad! I'm pretty sure she won't be returning... :(  The best advice I can give about Red Robin is to order a burger or chicken sandwich. That's what they do best! Salads and other meals are never a sure thing and really are not that great there. I usually get the California Chicken Burger and it is so good! My mom's turkey BALT was SUPER tasty. I should have ordered a sandwich this time! Shoot!  Anyway, I MIGHT be back.

It used to be one of our favorite places to go. They changed the quality of meat you get in their burgers and now have to pay extra to get the same burger. We won't be going back until they switch back to the better meat.

I had the Royal Burger. Best burger I ever had. I dont even like burgers and I'm not a fan of chain restaurants, but there it is. We had a group of 7 people and 1 baby. Lindsay was an outstanding server.  Great lunch experience. Gahhhhh I'm not used to liking something so much. Im at a loss for quips and sarcastic comments.

I don't venture out to chain restaurants in the suburbs that much, but a co-worker forwarded me an email about their Jim Day with this as the subject: "Free burger for all Jims, Jamies, Jimmys." So I emailed my father Jim, and asked him to call my brother Jimmy to see if the three of us could all get together for a free burger at Red Robin. Yes, my father named two children after himself, but with different mothers so that makes it OK. Actually, the mothers both had the same name too. Maybe that is weird. Anyhow... We started with a tower of THE most amazing onion rings, served with sides of ranch and a fantastic honey mustard dipping sauce. That appetizer was $9/$10(?). Kind-of a lot for onion rings perhaps but these really were incredible. Of course, we all got the Sweet Jim Beam Bacon Swiss Burger. The sauce was extremely good. But my father and I ordered ours done medium and what we got was medium-well; no trace of pink at all. Also, considering the regular price of the burgers they were average size; not as huge as I had heard. Note: If you are into endless fries, theirs are bottomless.  Overall we had a great time and the service was fine. I can just think of plenty of other places for a larger and just as tasty of a burger at a better price, ya know...when they are not free :)

Second time back after my initial review.  I have to say that things are now much better here.  The restaurant has been refreshed inside and out with a new look and fresh decor.  Service was stellar...I think Keherysten was her name.  Really good and she knows how to get her guests to upgrade without being pushy.  The food was great as always.  Lastly, silverware was properly brandished and spot free.
Don't come here before supper most of the workers are sitting around, eating food in front of customers. Most of them aren't smiling or happy.

Good food and good staff.  I sat in the bar area because it was faster the day I went for lunch.  I was hungry and ended up getting a refill on the fries before leaving.  The food was prompt and well cooked and tasted great and the bartender was a very friendly guy who was attentive and polite.  Overall, good experience.
The food  was terrible , grilled chicken salad , Cesar salad , chicken fingers.  The staff was nice but the food was not. We won't be going back. Very  noisy too

Alright, so I guess I do frequent this national chain as well (other than Bonefish). And we usually leave pleased. I mean the cheeseburger IS the best BK Whopper you've ever had (or the best one you remember as a kid). I did find it strange that with so many kids around that not one TV was showing anything other than sports. I mean, I miss the Ground Round I knew as a kid, playing The Three Stooges and The Little Rascals. Bring that back. Tip: The fries are not the only side that is bottomless: the salad, broccoli, and slaw are endless too with NO surcharge. Nice.

I used to love this restaurant...I had not been here in awhile so I thought I would give it a try again. I was not impressed; their menu had changed and their prices have gone up. It seems like they  are finding ways to cut corners and their food isn't as good as it has been in the past. They used to have all these sauces you could get for your fries and appetizers, but now for most of them their is an extra charge. The ranch was watered down and there was bbq sauce in their spicy ketchup...total turn offs. The burger was so greasy it made the bun soggy and gross. The waitress was very nice and prompt with getting us the things we needed. If they are going to slack in ways on their food to save a dollar here and there I will not be returning. This was a disappointing meal and nothing like I remember.

Food and service were both great but the location was dirty.  Don't know if they were just having a busy day but there was stuff all over floors, front entry a mess, bathrooms a disaster.  Worries you a little when the front of the house is a disaster.
Not the best service from my experience, and I felt sick to my stomach afterwards. Not impressed.

I've always have a great burger here when i can finally decide. However, the last time we went our server was inattentive and not very well kept (NOT trying to cause any problems but she was XXL-if you know what i mean)...my girl is vegetarian and we were very disappointed and surprised they didnt have a veggie burger so she ordered the clam chowder soup and a salad. Well, within 2 hours she was sick-very sick! She had to run to the toilet 3x times during the course of the night bcuz it was coming out of both ends...I wrote this review a month after bcuz i go there alot with my boys and dont want to be remembered if she sees this and still works there. The soup was not her fault but poor service AND getting my girl sick earns 1 star.
Waiting over 30 mins for our food when the place is half empty. Don't tell me "we're busy".  You are a restaurant. This is a fail.

I decided to introduce my fiancée to Red Robin on our date last weekend. The hostess was sooo friendly as soon as we walked in. Our waitress was great. She was attentive and very nice. Food was delicious, but I get the same thing every time I go because I know what I like. My fiancée said his burger was good. Freckled lemonade was delicious as always. We had a wonderful date! Thanks!

I love good burgers and I love coupons and deals....so this place is definitely for me!  Bit of info....if you sign up for their loyalty program (buy 10 burgers get one free... and it's all kept track of for you with the use of your loyalty card) you get a FREE burger on your birthday... and your kids get 'em too.  YIPPEE!! I went here tonight for my son's birthday burger.  We were warmly greeted and promptly seated.  Our waitress was friendly and helpful.  The menu has many, many creative burgers... as well as salads, sandwiches, and appetizers.  So much to choose from! My son (the lover of all things spicy) had a "Burning Love Burger" which is topped with jalapenos, pepper jack cheese, lettuce, tomatoes, onion, salsa, and chipotle mayo.  Lots of flavors and he loved it.  I had a patty melt.  It was probably one of the best patty melts I've ever had.  Terrific marble rye.... not too greasy, a choice of cheese (I choose Swiss....yum!) and homemade thousand island dressing.  DELISH.  All burgers come with bottomless fries and those fries are wonderful.  Hot and crispy on the outside.... tender on the inside... and not overly salty. After the burgers were done (and we had our fill of fries) the waitress brought my son a complimentary birthday sundae accompanied by a group of singing waitresses. TERRIFIC burgers..... loyalty bonuses.... bottomless fries..... birthday burgers..... and singing waitresses bringing birthday sundaes.  FANTASTIC!!

My fiance and his sister LOVE Red Robin. They come here at least once a month which is a big deal for them. I usually order the All-American. Until I read online that it is the highest calorie item on the menu. So this time when I went, I decided to order something "healthier." I got the Whiskey BBQ Chicken Sandwich. It was supposed to come with chicken, BBQ sauce, "onion rings" and cheese. I put the onion rings in quotes because they ended up being literally onions cut into rings. No breading or grease. Not the deep fried delicious onion rings that are often served. I was confused. But oh well. I also noticed on a lot of people's reviews that they did not get a lot of "bottomless fries" we ended up getting 3 extra baskets. Which was more than enough for us. We were also able to take a lot home with us.

This place was VERY okay. I wouldn't pay that much for their burgers. If you want tastier burgers, I'd suggest Five Guys. This place does have more variety but the burger itself wasn't tasty at all. I gave it two stars for the bottomless strawberry lemonade and our server who, even on a Friday evening during happy hour, kept a smile on her face and made us feel important to her. The bottomless fries were too salty in my opinion and it was freezing inside even though it was crowded. I might come back one day but not for a long time.

I don't usually go to chain restaurants, but Red Robin made the cut (I had a gift card).  My burger was absolutely delicious and well priced. Service was great-the manager even checked on us twice! If you are looking for a good quality, inexpensive meal with great service; this is your place!

I have been to this Red Robin once. This Red Robin also refused to refill my drink and bottomless fries. At least, they would have, if they ever returned to the table. I had to chase them down to get the bill, which was good exercise and I could probably use it, considering the fries I did eat were greasy and fattening. This Red Robin only gets one star, because the fries I did get were not cooked very well.

This is a fairly typical chain restaurant with a few perks: Bottomless fries, root beer floats, and freckled lemonade- this is a great addition. I've tried the root beer float and freckled lemonade on separate occasions and both were delicious; well worth the price and I definitely drank my money's worth. I ordered the crispy chicken sandwich today, fairly standard meal. The service was great, our waitress was very attentive and courteous. I've no complaints about the food, but it definitely didn't wow me taste wise. However, it was good, and I would definitely go back again when I'm in the mood for something pretty basic.

This is your typical chain burger restaurant.  However, the food is reasonably priced, very tasty, and the wait staff is very friendly.  I don't think I've ever had a burger here that I did not like, even their chicken burgers are very tasty. The best part, BOTTOMLESS FRIES!!! Be sure to get the campfire sauce to dip your fries in. I'd be careful coming here for dinner on the weekends.  It tends to be very packed because alot of families come here for dinner.  Expect to wait 20-30 minutes for a table during the weekend dinner rush, otherwise there usually is plenty of seating.

I love this Red Robin. Awesome customer service (especially when I came in an hour before closing).. Never had a bad burger experience. Bottomless fries. Bottomless sweet potato fries (extra buck or so). Onion Ring funnel thing. Blue Moon Shake. And a waiter that looks like Jason Mraz. What else can you ask for? (Only reason why I gave it 4 instead of 5 stars is when they messed up a surprise birthday plan I gave them specific easy instructions to.) Overall, had a good experience each time I went!

I went to the resteraunt on a Saturday with 3 people plus me and it was pretty packed! However we were seated in 20 minutes and our waitress was very nice! The food was great, I ordered a wrap and bottomless fries. I asked my friends what they also thought of the food and they all loved it also. Highly recommended!!

Everybody knows the jingle, RED ROBIN...MEH. Oh wait, that's not how it goes? Well it should because that's how the meal was. The one bright shinning moment of the dinner was the onion ring tower, it was hot and delicious and the sauce that came with it was awesome. I was expecting something along the lines of a blooming onion sauce but it was more of a smokey BBQ sauce. I ordered some fancy smancy lemonade drink which albeit girly was delicious and I recommend getting it! If you do, get a glass of water on the side because it is pretty sweet. One major problem was the waitresses do not make the drinks themselves they have to put it into a system and have the bar do it which slows the process down greatly.After the tower and drinks the expectations for the meal were high to say the least but boy did that not last long. the food took a very long time to come out and when it did it was luke warm. The sweet potato fries practically had ice on them and the person I was with had a mushroom burger with both the burger and mushrooms being cold and bland. I myself had the southern charm burger which was decent, it had brown sugar-glazed half-pound Black Angus beef patty, candied bacon, house-made honey BBQ sauce, extra-sharp Cheddar, seared red onions, lettuce and mayo served on a toasted ciabatta bun. It almost seemed like the staff was stretched too thin...this mediocre meal was not cheap either, this is not the place to go if you're looking for cheap.
I love the Peppercorn Burger. Avoid the creepy manager.

The commercials for Red Robin are sooo alluring! They have the burgers looking all big, tall, and juicy with all these toppings on 'em and mmm... *wiping drool up.* What a tease since there is not 1 freakin' location near me. Well, I had no idea there were any locations in NY, so I was surprised when my honey found this one. I ordered the guacamole burger, steak fries, and a Pepsi (since sweet tea is non-existent here, LOL!). My burger was big & plump; I could barely finish. BUT--- the flavor was lacking a little. Do they not season the beef? I dunno. But it was a bit plain, even with the guacamole. The fries were great, and our server told us they were "bottomless". We totally did not take advantage of that, though.  I limped to the car with a full belly and my left-overs and was glad to say I've finally visited a Reeeed Robin! Yuummm!!

Red Robin is a true star in the world of tavern burgers.  With so many burgers to choose from, I opted for the seasonal Oktoberfest burger which comes with black forest ham, swiss cheese, sauteed onions and beer mustard on top of a pretzel bun. It took a while to come, but it really was worth the wait. I'm really picky about my burgers, but let me say these guys know how to cook a burger. Extremely juicy, tender and packed with flavor you'd think the other ingredients would have overpowered the burger, but nein! The pretzel bun was kind of cool to look at but it didn't really taste much like a pretzel. A bit lacking in salt in my opinion. Still a solid 4 out of 5 for the burger. The sweet potato fries were really moist, but not soggy like many I've had before. Good call on the substitution Mike! My only regret at Red Robin is that I didn't leave enough room for the Sam Adams milkshake. I'm still training my stomach to stretch a little further.

I really enjoyed my meal there tonight. First off, friendly greeting and quick seating. Waitress was a bit behind, but kept up enough that my drink was never empty. They have a terrific menu, of course I had a plain old bacon cheeseburger...cooked perfectly though. They weren't  skimpy on the bacon either. I can't say I have any real complaints that doesn't make me look too knit picky. Prices pretty reasonable...all you can eat steak fries....see there's a great reason to go alone...all you can eat steak fries.
Went here with a friend for dinner.  Drinks were exceptional and the bottomless fruit salad was a great option instead of the fries!  Wait staff was also so pleasant.

I don't expect much from chains- this was just convenient before going to the mall. I guess don't order a veggie burger at a place known for meat, whatever. My boyfriend ate all of his beef burger and we both enjoyed the fries. My veg burger sucked - it was like eating plywood (I ate about three bites,) and I have eaten some AWESOME vegetarian burgers in my life. Server was very nice, however, I get annoyed when I have to flick off lettuce from my seat before sitting.

Horrible service.  Went for lunch.  Waited 10 min at the bar.  No bartender to be seen.  Waited 12 min at a table.  Finally a waitress showed up.  Can you get me a burger in 5 min?  Oh wait no more time to eat.  Might be good but not for lunch unless you have an hour to wait

Wow, this used to be our absolute favorite place to eat. We drive to Buffalo a few times a year and this was our go-to place. We used to praise Red Robin burgers so much you'd think we had stock in the company. I really don't know what happened, burgers went downhill. They've become so dry. Endless fries are excellent, but a 3 hour drive for fries?  No, we expect the great burgers we used to eat.  And please go back to the baskets, you don't need to fancy up the plates, this is a burger joint, not The Cheesecake Factory!  The manager they have now is very young and extremely arrogant.  He talks down to staff and has an ego the size of the Red Robin mascot.  A huge turnoff.  I don't know where he came from or what happened to the previous manager/s. but Red Robin, come on, get your act together.  We are NOT dining here ever again.  There are way too many choices!

Tried this place for the first time last week and loved it! Great gourmet burgers.  You can build your own or go with one of their custom burgers.  I recommend the pinapple one... yummy!  But if you aren't in the mood for a burger they have a good menu... salads (and not only iceberg lettuce like other Buffalo restaurants!), chicken, turkey burgers...etc. It's an upscale burger joint with unlimted steak fries!  How could you go wrong?  You're talking to a fry-a-holoic here!  Yes, they give you limited fries to begin with but you can run the waitress as often as you like for a refill on the fries.  And i am one that doesn't feel shy about that one! Totally a great burger and you can even get sweet potato fries... but those aren't unlimited.  Milk shakes are yummy too!  I'd totally recommend this place... why go to burger king or mcdonalds when you can go up the street and eat a decent burger for just a little bit more money? Definately a great place to check out.
Good burgers and food for a chain place. Very kid friendly and decently priced. Never have to wait long to be seated. Staff is friendly and attentive too.

Everyone in my group enjoyed their meal here. I'd give them 3.5 stars, but I'll be nice and round up to 4. 2 people got burgers with fries, 1 person got turkey burger and 1 person got cod fish sandwich (which came in a burger bun). We shared mac & cheese and broccoli side dishes. The burgers are HUGE and fries are THICK, warm and their special seasoning sprinkled on top (you sprinkle). The burgers were made to order, so they were fresh and pretty good. No one had anything to complain about. The fries ARE unlimited because the waitress brought us a whole new basket to share (fresh).  Service was attentive, but not in your face and the restaurant very clean. Their burgers aren't the most unique, but their fries and the fact that YOU, the customer, can control the seasoning bumped their rating to 3.5 (4) stars.

Bottomless fries?  I THINK NOT! Red Robin advertises bottomless fries with every order of burger.  However, what they don't tell you is that they'll do whatever they can to get your sorry a** out of the restaurant so that you cannot keep getting your refills. Trust me, I've been here MANY times and every single time, I've only been able to get my fries filled once or twice without them acting up.  How do they rush you out? 1. The waitress brings you your check after you've asked for your refill, whether your dinner is near completion or not. 2. The waitress will give you a dirty look for asking for more fries (usually happens after 2nd or 3rd time). 3. The waitress will stop coming by your table so that you cannot ask for more fries. 4. The waitress will take forever to bring you your fries, probably in hopes that you'll be closer to being done with your meal. Think I'm paranoid?  I've spoken to many others who've visited this restaurant and the vast majority of them have agreed with me that they're unable to get their refills without feeling this sense of guilt created by the waitresses.

Visiting from out of town and went to Red Robin on Maple as my family had always wanted to try it.  The place is very clean and attractive with lots of TV's and a nice atmosphere.  After getting seated we studied the menu for a good 10 minutes before anyone showed up to take our drink order.  By then we knew what we wanted but our server just went quickly to grab the drinks.   The menu has a lot of burger choices, along with chicken sandwiches, salads and a few specials.  It requires a bit of studying, because they like to have cutesy names for their items, but ultimately it isn't too hard to find something. We ordered burgers with fries although one of us tried the fried chicken sandwich..  The restaurant was not crowded at all (this was Monday around 12:30) but it took a long time to get our food.   I wasn't sure why, but when it arried we could see the much publicized fries were a bit soggy, undercooked and quite frankly not appealing.  Given how long it took to order and receive our food, we just decided to keep them. Because one of the burgers was dripping with bbq sauce, we quickly asked for additional napkins.   We ate our meals and our server apparently just forgot.  He came back (long overdue) to offer us drink refills and inquire if we wanted more fries but by then all we wanted was our napkins and a check. The burgers and fried chicken sandwich were both excellent.  Their was no disagreement about that.  None of us liked the fries and while our server was very nice, he clearly didn't distinguish himself or the restaurant.   We all agreed that this was a one time event.  There are too many other places locally where we can get a burger equally as good and get better service. I could have give this 3 stars to be nice, but quite frankly the 2 star rating says "Meh I've experienced better" while 3 stars is 'A-OK".  Baaed on these descriptions, 2 stars sums up our experience exactly.   It was nothing special and given that I am out of town, I wish we had just taken the easy way our and went to Ted's (or Andersons for that matter).  That would have been a better 'Buffalo' experience.
This update is basically because they reached out to me on here.  I feel adding a 3 star review is a good reward.  Carry on...

Expensive drinks but tasty food! And a free burger on your birthday if you sign up for the email club.  Burger choices are only "some pink" or "no pink" but I always stick with the chicken bruschetta or caprese, they're both delicious. Hubby loves the whiskey river and burning love burgers. You can get cantaloupe, veggies, or a salad instead of fries but you have to ask.

I came here on Tuesday afternoon with my girlfriend after a movie around 4pm. I was surprised there was actually people given the time and day, but for me that's a good sign. We were greeted fairly quickly by the hostess who took us to a large sized booth instead of one of those tiny "2 person" booths that are made for children, bonus points right there already. Our server asked us if we had been before (which I had not) and she happily briefly explained what Red Robin was all about and asked for our drink order. I ordered pop, and my girlfriend ordered a beer. She proceeded to ID my girl but not me, which in my mind is the right thing to do. She brought back our drinks (the beer took about 3-5 minutes longer than my pop) and then we ordered. Our food arrived approx. 15 minutes later. I ordered the Royal Red Robin burger which has cheese, bacon, and a "fried" egg (everything a growing boy needs). The burger was big enough that I needed to cut it in half. I was surprised that the yolk started running when I cut into the burger, but I'm fine with that I actually prefer a runny egg on my burger and to dip my fries in (I'm gross, I know). The burger was quite good to my surprise, I'd put it up there with Chili's as far as a chain restaurant goes for a burger. My girl ordered a burger with pineapple on it (can't remember the name) but she enjoyed it as well. The fries were just ok in my opinion, but then again I'm not a huge fan of steak fries. I think when I come here the next time I'll opt for the sweet potato fries. Our waitress came over when our meals were gone and asked us if we'd like a refill on drinks or fries, but we both declined and our check was promptly brought to us. Very reasonably priced ($30 for 2 burgers, pop, and a 16 oz beer) and I actually got $5 back on my Citi card which was an unexpected surprise. I'll be back, good quality, great service!

I usually go for a fancier meal when I go to eat but its funny because when anyone asks what my favorite restaurant is I always say 'Red Robin" I love that I get a free burger on my birthday and that they have the garlic parm fries (not on the menu...no upcharge and bottomless if you ask) I am a vegetarian and I like that they have morningstar and boca burgers and the option of having a bun or lettuce wrapped. This is SO important to me. Every year without fail this is where I have my bday dinner with my parents!

The variety of burgers is great and the bottomless fries are a plus. The mixed drinks are amazing as I went through quite a few on my birthday. It was a busy night but we were seated in about half of the expected time and the bar is a nice place to wait if need be.

Great service!  Bottomless fries!  Great burgers!  Fast!  Root beer floats are only $3.19 and they are bottomless too!  Only reason I give it 4 stars and not 5 is the prices.  I don't like paying $10 for Burger and fries. I still come here though Cuz it's pretty great.  : P
I generally like this place, but how can a restaurant thus size has no WiFi?  That's a huge let down especially when we have kids.

Yum.  Sign up online & get a free birthday burger (or kids meal). It's an awesome place for birthdays, they sing, bring icecream & a balloon. Delicious food & bottomless drinks & fries. They also do gardenburger or boca burgers as a free substitution on any burger! Or you can order a "petite" size which is smaller for $1 less.  Tasty, thick shakes.  My only complaint is that they are getting so pricey!!

seven words to describe this FYNE burger establishment... MOUTH-WATERING BURGERS, UNLIMITED FRIES, FREE REFILLS! not only are the burgers cooked to perfection, they are also fully customizable. sure they have your regular, ordinary plain burgers, but they also have a variety of their own special burgers which aren't very common.  when i went here, i ordered the A1. Peppercorn which has bacon, peppercorn jack, A1 peppercorn spread, fried onions and a tomato on an onion bun! the burger with fries and a soft drink run me around $11 or so, but it was definitely worth it.  you leave the restaurant feeling like a TRUE blooded american...and then wanting to possibly vomit an hour later from feeling an uncomfortable sensation of being over-stuffed :(

I've heard that the burgers here are amazing. My friends and I went after a day of horrible schooling to experience the great burgers. I had the Burnin' Love Burger. It is...nothing special. It's just meat in a bun with jalapenos and apparently 1000+ calories. It was just one taste over and over again...mayonnaise? I mean, I definitely like the size and the beef, but the flavor needs to be worked on.
This is THE place for a great burger. I had never dined at this chain before, but I was pleasantly surprised. The menu was great. Service was OK, could have been better.

Few places in WNY have chile poblano on their menu. I'm Mexican and LOOOOVE spicy foods... so when I saw they had a burger with that!! I flipped out!!  It was fantastic... LOVE the bottomless fries!!!!  and I would almost give them 5 stars. BUT....  Although I SUPER DUPER EXTRA specified that I want my meat SUPER well-done.. NO PINK AT ALL.... from the ~4 times I've gone, half the time they bring it pink and then by the time I get it back... my friend is done with his food. :(  So, it didn't matter that I truly specified how WELL WELL-DONE I want it... it normally doesn't happen.  That's my only complaint. And the prices are a little over the top, but for poblano peppers... YUM!!  BTW.. I think the burger's called Santa Fe or something like that.  LOL Shakes are good too. :)  I've stayed at a Red Robin over 2 hrs just eating food and dessert and nice chatter. :P
I love their bottomless cheese sprinkled fries. Enormous sandwiches/burgers.
